subject: Suspensions, Dismissals and Resignations
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Robby Gordon was docked 100 points and his crew chief was suspended for six races and fined $100,000 as Nascar penalized 10 teams Wednesday for Nationwide Series infractions at Daytona International Speedway. Dale Earnhardt Jr. was one of seven drivers penalized, and six crew chiefs were suspended. Todd Bodine, the winner of the Truck Series race, was one of two drivers penalized in that series.The harshest penalty went to Gordon, who had an unapproved front bumper cover on his No. 7 Dodge during an opening-day inspection for the Daytona 500. The deduction of points dropped him t0 41st in the standings from 9th. Frank Kerr, Gordon’s crew chief, is not eligible to return to the track until April 12 in Phoenix. Kerr was also placed on probation through the end of the year.
